info.name: YumYumNow Delivery
info.description: ## Run instructions for the TA Dear TA, In the repository, you can find a postman file, which contains all the endpoints implemented, already set up and ready to be tested. There are however a couple things to keep in mind when running the requests: - The version on the main branch is integrated with _Wiremock Cloud_. This means that all the requests made to other microservices are sent to our mocked server which will return responses based on the API spec of the other groups. If you want to check integration with the real servers, you need to change the [application.properties](https://gitlab.ewi.tudelft.nl/cse2115/2023-2024/group-11/team-11b/-/blob/main/yumyumnow-delivery-microservice/src/main/resources/application.properties) file to work with localhost. This is simply done by (un)commenting the correct lines. - Some endpoints need to be ran before the others, otherwise they will return an error response. For example, the endpoint to change delivery time depends on a preparation time to be set. The enpoint setting the latter one should be ran first to ensure correct order of events. The requests are numbered and put in order for your convenience. - As the database doesn't autoconnect after a server is stopped (read: it's non persistent), the application will generate a sample delivery with a fixed ID every time you run the server and save it to the database. This ID is also set as a variable in postman, such that you don't need to change it for every request. If you wish to test the endpoints with a different delivery (which you can generate by running the "_Create a delivery"_ endpoint), you can change the variable in the upper level file in postman, under the variable tab (you'll see it in the tree structure when opened in postman). - The mocked server returns users and orders with a specific, pre-set ID. If you change those values in request bodies, you will probably encounter errors, as the application is very resilient and checks for validity of objects for many requests. When integrating with the real services, you should keep in mind that their ID's are probably different, so you'll need to change the values. - **Last, but not least: if you just want to check if the endpoints work, you can just run all the requests in the postman setup, without changing anything** We hope to have informed you enough about how to run and check our application. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us and we'll try to help. One last thing: if you don't know how to run the server, just run the `bootRun` configuration from the Gradle menu, or set up a new IntelliJ Spring run configuration with [Application.java](https://gitlab.ewi.tudelft.nl/cse2115/2023-2024/group-11/team-11b/-/blob/main/yumyumnow-delivery-microservice/src/main/java/nl/tudelft/sem/yumyumnow/delivery/Application.java) as the entry point.

item.name: 1. Update the location of the delivery

request.description: Update the current location of the delivery (for couriers).

response.name: Update the location of the delivery

item.name: 2. Update the status of a delivery

request.description: Update the status of a delivery. Vendors can set the status to ACCEPTED, REJECTED, PREPARING, GIVEN_TO_COURIER. Couriers can set the status to IN_TRANSIT, DELIVERED.
Set estimated prep time of an existing delivery (for vendors).
Update estimated prep time of an existing delivery (for vendors).

item.name: 5. Assign the delivery to the courier

request.description: The delivery is assigned to a courier.
Set estimated delivery time of an existing delivery (for couriers).
Update estimated delivery time of an existing delivery (for couriers).

item.name: 9. Set whether a vendor allows only its own couriers

request.description: Vendors can set whether they allow only their own couriers to deliver their food.

item.name: 10. Set the maximum delivery zone of a vendor

request.description: Vendors can set a maximum delivery zone for their own restaurant if they have their own drivers.
Get delivery details based on id.
Get the encountered issues

item.name: 13. Set the default maximum delivery zone

request.description: Set the default maximum application-wide delivery zone in kilometers for all vendors. This default value is used if a vendor has not specified the delivery zone.

item.name: 14. Get the default maximum delivery zone

request.description: Get the default maximum application-wide delivery zone in kilometers for all vendors. This default value is used if a vendor has not specified the delivery zone.
